description:
Google’s Sales Platform, a thoughtful, beautiful, and powerful platform, is responsible for the end-to-end lifecycle for all of Google Ads customers. Sales Platform is how we acquire and manage our customers.

We're looking for an independent UX Leader who can establish an amazing vision and drive working definition to ensure that Sales Platform remains and continues to grow as an undisputed core strength and superpower behind Google’s success. Your charter will include working with partners across various Google teams and locations, staffing your team with additional firepower, and working with your Product Management and Engineering partners to operationalize your vision into reality. You will define and deliver the absolute best way to fulfill the needs of Google Customers while enhancing the business growth and productivity.

You’ll be a part of Customer Engagement User Experience (CEUX), a team with fun culture and strong shared values. CEUX owns charter for customer support, Sales customer lifecycle for Google Ads, and a suite of amazingly powerful internal development applications which empower teams to build software and processes across Google.

Users come first at Google. Nowhere is this more important than on our Advertising & Commerce team: we believe that ads and commercial information can be highly useful to our users if, and only if, that information is relevant to what our users wish to find or do. Advertisers worldwide use Google Ads to promote their products; publishers use AdSense to serve relevant ads on their website; and business around the world use our products (like Google Shopping, and Google Wallet) to support their online businesses and bring users into their offline stores. We build and maintain the platforms that have made Google what it is today, and are constantly innovating to deliver the most effective advertising and commerce opportunities of tomorrow.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience in UX Design.
  • Experience participating in or designing systems for sales related processes.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience providing amazing consumer-grade experiences powered by multiple underlying enterprise-grade services.
  • Proven design leader who can grow and inspire their organization and the teams they interact with.
  • Exceptional collaboration and presentation skills and ability to communicate design rationale to high-level stakeholders.
responsibilities:
• Guide and build a healthy, skillful, effective UX organization, process, and culture for effective partnerships and product stewardship.
  • Partner with cross-functional leads to create a culture of respect and inclusiveness that enables equal opportunities for influence and impact across your organization and roles, particularly for UX.
  • Foster a collaborative, cross-functional culture that aligns resourcing and agendas from all perspectives.
  • Build relationships with your cross-functional partners and business stakeholders to ensure product excellence, innovations, and user effectiveness.
title: Director, UX, Sales Platform
